snippet: Faculty members at one school on the New York University campus will decide whether they should hold a vote about the university’s president, John Sexton.
abstract: Faculty at New York University's School of Arts and Sciences plan to meet to decide whether to hold a no-confidence vote about university president John Sexton; some faculty members say Sexton has been unresponsive to their concerns, particularly on subject of university's plans to expand in Greenwich Village and its controversial efforts to establish footholds around the world.
lead_paragraph: Faculty members at one school on the New York University campus will decide whether they should hold a vote about the university’s president, John Sexton.

headline.seo: Sexton, N.Y.U. President, Faces Prelude to a Possible No-Confidence Vote
headline.main: N.Y.U. Head Faces Prelude to a No-Confidence Vote
headline.print_headline: N.Y.U. Head Faces Prelude To a No-Confidence Vote
